PrivacyPage.privacy:
CommiHub is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy describes to you our practices regarding the Personal Data (as defined below) we collect from users of our website, located at CommiHub.com ('Site') and the services made available through the Site ('Services'). Additional policies and a description of the services are provided in the CommiHub Terms of Service which also define the usage and restrictions of our Services.

User Consent

By submitting Personal Data through our Site or Services, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy and you expressly consent to the processing of your Personal Data in accordance with this Privacy Policy. Types and Use of Data We Collect

CommiHub collects the following Personal Data from you when you sign up and use our Services; Contact Information - name, email address, mailing address, phone number, etc. Identity Verification Information - Social Security Number, date of birth, etc. Payment Information - credit card or bank account numbers, billing addresses, etc. Additional information provided by using our services or via feedback and contacting us such as, but not limited to; gender, salary, demographic data, marital status, loan and credit card monthly payment, total amount and interest rates, home value.

Other Information We Collect Online

Other Information is any information other than Personal Information that does not reveal your specific identity or does not directly relate to an individual, such as: Browser information Information collected through cookies, web beacons, and other technologies Demographic information and other information provided by you such as your date of birth or household income Aggregated and De-identified data

Information Obtained from Third Parties

If you provide us personal information about third parties, or if third parties give us your information, we will only use that information for the specific reason for which it was provided to us. This includes information from credit bureaus, financial institutions, or other sources used to enhance use of our Services. Use of Your Data

In general, Personal Data is used in the following ways: to provide you with the Services to personalize and better tailor the features, performance and support of the Services for your use to send you administrative notifications, such as security or support and maintenance advisories to respond to your inquiries or other requests to send you promotional/marketing information, newsletters, surveys, offers or other information to provide you with opportunities and functionality that we think would be of particular interest to you to improve the quality of the Site and the Services, to analyze, benchmark and conduct research on, user data and user interactions with the Services to conduct market research, planning, troubleshooting, planning problems, detecting and protecting against error, fraud, or other criminal activity to solicit your feedback. Other information CommiHub uses (such as browser information, cookies, etc) is aggregated data for general purposes; to customize the content you see, improve our services, develop new services, and conduct research. Again, none of this data is tied to your personally identifiable information.

Disclosure of Your Personal Data

Forums, Message Boards and Chats. We may make message boards, chat rooms, and other interactive forums available on the Services. You should be aware that any information you provide in these areas may be read, collected, and used by others who access them. Other Disclosures. Regardless of any choices you make regarding your Personal Data (as described below), CommiHub may disclose Personal Data if it believes in good faith that such disclosure is necessary to (a) comply with relevant laws or to respond to subpoenas or warrants served on CommiHub or (b) protect or defend the rights or property of CommiHub or other users of the Services.

Third Parties

Links to Third Party Websites The Services may link to websites operated by third parties that we do not control. Our provision of such links is for your convenience and does not signify our endorsement of such other website or location or its products, services, or contents. When you click on such a link, you will leave our site and go to another site. During this process, any Personal Data submitted by you to any of those sites is governed by their privacy statements. We encourage you to carefully read the privacy statement of any websites you visit. Please be aware that the terms of this Privacy Policy do not apply to these outside websites, or to any collection of data after you click on links to such outside websites. Disclosure to Third Party Service Providers We may employ, and share your Personal Data with, third party companies and individuals ('Service Providers') to facilitate or enhance our Site or Services, to provide the Services on our behalf, to perform tasks, or to assist us in analyzing how our Services are used. These third party service providers are required not to use or disclose your Personal Data other than to provide the services requested by us. You expressly consent to the sharing of your Personal Data with our Service Providers for the sole purpose of providing services requested by us. Disclosure to Third Party Companies We may enter into agreements with Third Party Companies. A Third Party may want access to Personal Data that we collect from its customers. As a result, we may disclose your Personal Data to a Third Party Company; however, we will not disclose your Personal Data to Third Party Companies for the Third Party Companies’ own direct marketing purposes, unless you have 'opted-in' by following the instructions we provide to allow such disclosure. If you have opted-in to receive email communications from a Third Party Company and later wish to discontinue receipt of these emails, please contact the Third Party Company directly to update your preferences. The privacy policies of our Third Party Companies may apply to the use and disclosure of your Personal Data that we collect and disclose to such Third Party Companies. Because we do not control the privacy practices of our Third Party Companies, you should read and understand their privacy policies. Advertising We may have agreements with companies that serve advertising on the Services on behalf of third parties. Choices and Opt-Out We offer you choices regarding the collection, use, and sharing of your Personal Data. We may periodically send messages via email, telephone, postal mail, or SMS that notify you of updates to your progress through the Site or Services or when you reach a goal/target. In addition we may provide you with updates regarding the Site or Services, and directly promote the use of the Site or Services and may contain advertisements for Third Party Companies. When you receive newsletters or promotional communications from us, you may indicate a preference to stop receiving further communications from us and you will have the opportunity to 'opt-out' by contacting us directly (please see contact information below) or within your defined preferences.

Security of Your Personal Data

CommiHub is committed to protecting the security of your Personal Data. We use a variety of industry-standard physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards to help protect your Personal Data from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. We also require you to enter a password to access your account information. Please do not disclose your account password to unauthorized people. From the time you login to our Site, communications between your computer and our Site are encrypted using secure socket layer (SSL) technology. While CommiHub uses these and other reasonable efforts to protect your Personal Data, no method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure. Therefore, CommiHub cannot guarantee absolute security of your Personal Data.

Contact Information

CommiHub welcomes your comments or questions regarding this Privacy Policy. Please email us at help@CommiHub.com or contact us at the following address: CommiHub LLC Attn: Customer Service 13911 Ridgedale Dr Suite 401C Minnetonka, MN 55305 Correcting and Updating Your Personal Information To review and update your personal information to ensure it is accurate, contact us by email.

Changes to This Privacy Policy

This privacy policy may be modified from time to time to comply with applicable laws or to conform to our current business practices. If we modify this privacy policy, we will notify you by sending you an email and/or by prominently posting notice of the changes on our Site. We encourage you to revisit the Privacy Statement that is posted on our web site from time to time to check for updates. This Privacy Policy was last revised on February 11, 2014.

UserTermsPage.terms:
PLEASE CAREFULLY REVIEW THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS BEFORE USING THIS SITE. YOUR USE OF THIS SITE AND, SEPARATELY, YOUR ENROLLMENT IN OUR SERVICES ARE ALL SUBJECT TO THE FOLLOWING TERMS AND CONDITIONS AND ALL APPLICABLE LAWS AND REGULATIONS. PLEASE READ THESE TERMS CAREFULLY. YOUR USE OF THE SITE OR YOUR ENROLLMENT CONSTITUTE YOUR AGREEMENT TO ABIDE BY EACH OF THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS SET FORTH BELOW. IF YOU DO NOT AGREE WITH ANY OF THESE TERMS OR CONDITIONS, YOU SHOULD EXIT THIS SITE IMMEDIATELY AND NOT VISIT, BROWSE THE SITE OR ENROLL IN OUR SERVICES. YOU AGREE THAT BY USING THE SERVICE YOU REPRESENT THAT YOU ARE AT LEAST 18 YEARS OLD AND THAT YOU ARE LEGALLY ABLE TO ENTER INTO THIS AGREEMENT.

User Agreement

The following are terms of a legal agreement (the 'Agreement') between you (“Landlord” or “Tenant” or “you”) and CommiHub, LLC ('CommiHub', 'we', or 'us'), that sets forth the terms and conditions for your use of this website (the 'Website'). The Website is owned and operated by CommiHub, LLC. This Website is being provided to you expressly subject to this Agreement. By accessing, browsing, and/or using this Website via any medium, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by the terms of this Agreement and to comply with all applicable laws and regulations.

Changes to Agreement

We reserve the right to amend this Agreement, at our sole discretion, at any time and may notify you by sending you an email or by posting the updated terms on our website. You should check this Agreement periodically for changes. All changes shall be effective upon posting posting and shall supersede all previous versions. Your continued use of the Site after any change to this Agreement constitutes your agreement to be bound by any such changes. We may terminate, suspend, change, or restrict access to all or any part of this Site without notice or liability.

Last updated – September 25, 2017

Services

CommiHub provides both online rental payment services and credit-related services for landlords, rental property owners, rental property managers (the 'Landlords'), and their respective tenants (the 'Tenants'). CommiHub's online rental payment services include, but are not limited to, electronic check, credit card, check scanning, pay-by-phone services, and pay-by-check services that enable monthly rent payments, recurring rent payments, and other fixed payments between Tenants and Landlords (the 'Payment Services'). CommiHub may also offer these Payment Services to Tenants and Landlords through partners and affiliates. CommiHub's credit-relates services include, but are not limited to, Tenant and Landlord identity verification, Tenant credit criminal and eviction screening for Landlords, credit profile analysis and simulation for Tenants, credit score display and monitoring for Tenants, rent payment reporting to credit bureaus for Tenants, and full credit report purchase for Tenants (the 'Credit Services').

CommiHub provides Tenants with the ability to report rent payments to credit bureaus (the 'Reporting Services'). Tenant acknowledges that each bureau has unique approaches to rental payment data furnishing and reporting. Rental payments and delinquencies will be reported to TransUnion, Equifax, and Experian for any tenant who makes payments through CommiHub and who verifies their identity within CommiHub. In addition and if desired, tenant has the ability to 'opt-out' of reporting immediately after they verify their identity. While CommiHub takes all commercially reasonable steps to report data correctly to the credit bureaus according to their methods and recommendations, CommiHub does not control the data at the bureaus and cannot guarantee the accuracy of the data on Tenant's credit report. Tenant understands that it may take up to six months for rental payment data to appear on credit bureau tradelines. If Tenant deems any payment data found on their credit report incorrect, CommiHub will assist Tenant in investigating the issue upon receipt of a written request from Tenant. In addition, Tenant may file a dispute with CommiHub or directly with the credit bureau, and we are obligated to respond to such a dispute under FCRA regulations.

Landlords acknowledge that they must report any outstanding balance at time of move-out or lease-end. Landlords also acknowledge that unless they record all rent payments in the Payment Services that were made through alternate means (i.e. paper check, cash), Tenant may not receive credit for these payments.

Landlords are eligible to use the Payment Services to collect rent and the Credit Services to verify Tenants' identity and screen Tenants' credit and background. Tenants are eligible to use the Payment Services in conjunction with a participating Landlord to pay rent and the Credit Services to view and monitor credit scores and profile data. Credit card, electronic check, paper check scanning, and pay-by-phone remittances, with the exception of some technology platform fees, are transferred directly from Tenant to Landlord. Both Tenant and Landlord will receive timely communication acknowledging payment initiation and settlement.

In addition to the services above, we may collect Tenant information, including but not limited to information retrieved such as credit score, credit profile data, or consumer entered or verified information such date of birth. Often, this data is collected merely to show the Tenant for education purposes or score monitoring products. This data is not shared with third parties in an identifiable manner. Based on this information, we may present Tenant with offers from associated affiliates (the 'Prequalified Affiliate Offers'). These offers may be presented through a variety of communication channels, including but not limited to email (if Tenant has 'opted in'), CommiHub Website ad placements, and telephone. CommiHub, at its discretion, and under separate agreement, may choose to share revenue from Affiliate Offers with Landlords.

CommiHub will receive Tenant's credit score from one or more credit bureaus. We may recalibrate this score to display a consistent score to our users. Our credit scores are not to be confused with FICO scores, Vantage scores, Empirica scores, Beacon scores, or any scores from TransUnion, Experian or Equifax, unless such scores are specifically labeled. All of our Scores may not be used to grant credit. They are for educational purposes only.

The Services and Affiliate Offers are not intended to provide any credit repair, legal, tax or financial advice. Tenant acknowledges that CommiHub is not a Credit Bureau and does not have direct influence over any aspect of credit, credit profiles, or how credit scores are calculated.

Obligation to Provide Accurate and Complete Information Where Required

In order to provide the Services, CommiHub is legally obliged to employ reasonable authentication methods to verify the identity of Tenants and Landlords. In order to use the Services, you agree to: (i) provide information about yourself and any associated business that is true, accurate, and complete as prompted by the Service's sign up process and (ii) where applicable and appropriate, maintain and update your information to keep it true, accurate, and complete. In the event that you falsify information, or provide inaccurate, untrue, or incomplete information, CommiHub may, at its sole discretion, suspend or terminate your access to the Services and deny any future access to the Services. You may not use the services for any illegal purpose or in any manner inconsistent with the terms and conditions of this agreement.

Payments Processing Policy

Payments
As a Tenant, you will have the opportunity to set up and review one-time or periodic rental payments through our Payment Services. You may set up a maximum of two (2) payments per month, at a maximum of $5000 USD per payment. When doing so, you authorize CommiHub's payment processor to electronically debit the checking account, debit card or credit card provided for the amount of the rent you specify, and when setting up periodic rental payments, for the frequency you specify on behalf of your Landlord. You also authorize CommiHub to charge a technology platform fee for processing payments where applicable. Any technology platform fees will be stated on the payment initiation form and payment review page. If this rent payment is dishonored or returned for any reason, you authorize an additional debit to the payment account you provide for $25 or the maximum amount allowed by state law, whichever is greater. For payments you believe were improperly made, CommiHub may, in its sole discretion, void, rescind, or issue a credit for your rent payment made through the Payment Services at any time prior to the remittance of payment to your Landlord. You waive the right to cancel credit card payments that have been cleared through our Payment Services.

CommiHub reserves the right to not accept a payment, or cancel recurring payments from any payment account(s) that have had one (1) or more failed, canceled, returned or other unsuccessful transaction. In the event, you the Tenant, attempt to make a payment on a blocked account you will be notified of your invalid payment account status. As a Tenant, you will also be notified by CommiHub if any active scheduled or recurring payments were canceled from a payment account due to one (or) more previous unsuccessful transactions.

As a Landlord, CommiHub can facilitate the creation of a merchant account for you so you can collect electronic check and credit card payments directly to your bank account. CommiHub will also provide reporting of payment acceptance and processing to the Landlord, including payment details and summaries. While CommiHub will retain proper records and use address verification services for each transaction, Landlord is also required to retain, for not less than two (2) years, original invoices, receipts, and bank statements related to the collection of rent from Tenants. In the unlikely event of a chargeback (credit card) or not-sufficient funds (electronic check) notice, your bank account will be immediately debited for the amount disputed or deemed not available.

All charges made through the Service are facilitated through our third-party payment processing services. As a condition of CommiHub enabling payment processing services through our third-party payment processor, you agree to provide CommiHub accurate and complete information, and you authorize CommiHub to share transaction information related to your use of the payment processing services provided by our payment processor. CommiHub may replace its third-party payment processing services without notice to you.

Scheduling
Payments initiated through CommiHub Payment Services may take several days to clear or be fully executed. For this reason, your credit card will be charged, your debit card will be debited or an Electronic Fund Transfer ('EFT') will be initiated as set forth on the payment confirmation page when you complete your payment information, which may be up to three (3) Business Days prior to the mailing date or direct deposit date of your payment. YOU MUST HAVE FUNDS AVAILABLE (IN THE CASE OF EFT PAYMENTS) OR CREDIT AVAILABILITY (IN THE CASE OF CREDIT CARD PAYMENTS) ON THE DATE THAT THE PAYMENT WILL BE WITHDRAWN OR PROCESSED AS PROVIDED ON THE PAYMENT CONFIRMATION PAGE THAT YOU RECEIVE UPON SCHEDULING A PAYMENT. Due to regulatory and risk concerns, we reserve the right to refuse to pay any payee whom you may designate for a payment. We will attempt to notify you promptly if we decide to refuse to pay a payee you have designated. This notification is not required if you undertake any Restricted Activity.

YOU, THE TENANT, ARE ULTIMATELY RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SURE YOUR PAYMENT GOES THROUGH. We advise you to log in on the day of your payment to double check that the payment is PAID. If you have emails enabled, we will also send you an email receipt when we execute the payment. We cannot be held responsible for late fees or missed payments due to any perceived usability issues, user interface misunderstandings, or other similar misgivings.

Ownership of Funds
Once your payment has been initiated and we have received the funds, these funds are held for the benefit of your designated payee (Landlord), and you shall have no rights to such funds. To the extent not immediately disbursed, upon receipt of your funds, such funds are held on behalf of the designated payee by our licensed payment processor. CommiHub is not a bank, savings and loan or regulated financial institution; funds being held by CommiHub are not protected by FDIC insurance. Neither you nor your payee will receive any interest on payment amounts for time that elapsed between the processing of your payment and the completion of the funding to the designated payee. Even though the funds may be held on behalf of your payee prior to distribution, you may not access such funds or cancel any transaction except as provided in these Terms of Use. CommiHub represents and warrants that it shall not use any rent payment funds to make any payment for its own account; provided, that it shall be entitled to any funds in that account that represent fees or other money due CommiHub.

Refunds
CommiHub will issue a full refund when both the Tenant and Landlord approve of the refund. CommiHub does not support partial refunds. CommiHub will honor refunds for up to 30 days after payments are initiated. Refunds requested after the 30 day period will need to be addressed outside of CommiHub directly between the Tenant and Landlord. If both parties do not agree on the refund amount and timing, please see CommiHub's Dispute Policy.

Disputes
If a dispute arises after payment is remitted to Landlord, or in the event the Tenant rescinds payment before remittance, or in the event of a chargeback or not-sufficient funds (NSF), the responsibility to settle the dispute rests with the Tenant and Landlord. In the event that the Landlord refuses to accept the payment, your payment liability to such Landlord may remain outstanding and unpaid and may be subject to penalties, late fees, interest charges, and possible eviction as assessed by the Landlord, all of which remain your responsibility. CommiHub and our payment processors cannot be held liable for delivering rent payments in dispute, or in not delivering rent payments where funds are refused, insufficient or charged back to the originating credit card.

Please print this agreement before reviewing and initiating any payments within the Site. To revoke authorization for periodic payments, please stop these payments within the Site, or contact CommiHub customer service at help@CommiHub.com or 866-841-9090.

Agent of the Payee
Through CommiHub's Payment Services, you may use any payment method accepted by CommiHub to make a rent payment to your Landlord. You acknowledge and agree that, with respect to any payment transaction initiated through CommiHub, CommiHub is acting on behalf of the payee and not as your agent. Except as otherwise provided herein, you shall have no ability to cancel any initiated transaction, and, once you initiate payment, those funds will be handled at the direction of the payee (Landlord).

In addition, how those funds are applied is also at the discretion of the payee (Landlord or Property Manager). For example, if you tell us that some portion of your payment was rent so that we might report that amount to the credit bureaus, this does not mean that the payee will apply any payment to rent charges first. You may have other outstanding charges that are greater than your payment amount resulting in all funds being applied to non-rent charges. Therefore, you may still be evicted for insufficient payments made to cover all of your outstanding charges including rent and other balances, and CommiHub cannot be held liable for this. It is your responsibility to understand your latest charges and balance before making a payment on CommiHub, and what the ramifications may be if you make only a partial payment.

Purchase Policy

Some of the services mentioned in this agreement may only be available for a fee. You will only be charged for fee-based services after we obtain your consent to pay such fees. We reserve the right to change fees for access to these Services, or to change what features and Services are available at different fee levels, at any time. You shall pay all fees incurred through your use of the Services at the rates in effect for the billing period in which such Services are delivered.

As a Tenant, you may have the opportunity to purchase additional Credit Services beyond the free Services we provide. These additional services are not related to the Prequalified Affiliate Offers, and may display different credit information than we use for the Prequalified Affiliate Offers.

You are entitled to a full refund of a credit report or credit service purchase if the data presented by our Credit Services is incorrect and does not match what is on file at TransUnion or in your TransUnion credit report retrieved through AnnualCreditReport.com. You acknowledge that we may display different scoring models than other sites, and scores and score history may not perfectly match those found on other sites.

Either your or CommiHub may cancel use of the Payment Services with or without cause at any time. Alternative methods to pay and receive rent must be available before cancellation. CommiHub cannot be held liable for missed rent payments as a result of Payment Services cancellation. You may cancel the service by calling 866-841-9090 or by emailing help@CommiHub.com. You will remain liable for all outstanding payments and fees due at the time of cancellation, and CommiHub may, at its discretion, initiate any final transactions to cover outstanding payments and fees upon cancellation.

Privacy

For information about our privacy policy and data security practices, please read our Privacy Policy, which hereby is incorporated in this Agreement. Your use of this Website is subject to our Privacy Policy. The policy explains how CommiHub treats your personal information when you access the Services. The privacy policy can be updated from time to time. If updates are made, we will notify you by sending you an email and/or by prominently posting notice of the changes on our Site.

Specific Consents Granted by your Enrollment

At the time that you verify your identity, you agree that you are providing to us the following specific consents (in addition to being subject to this Agreement):

You understand that by enrolling in CommiHub services, you are providing 'written instructions' to CommiHub, LLC under the Fair Credit Reporting Act authorizing CommiHub, LLC to obtain information from your personal credit profile or other information from Experian, TransUnion, or Equifax. You authorize CommiHub, LLC to obtain such information to verify your identity, provide you with your score and aggregated credit information, and to enable rent reporting to Experian, TransUnion, and Equifax. You may opt-out of rent reporting at any time by logging into your account and changing your settings.

Note that CommiHub, LLC does not extend credit to residents. The landlord or property manager has already extended credit by nature of signing a lease with the resident. CommiHub merely reports on the status of that lease. If we are unable to verify the identity of all parties involved in a transaction, CommiHub reserves the right to deny use of our product in accordance to KYC (Know Your Customer) and AML (Anti Money Laundering) payment processing regulations, or for any fair reason that we may deem will materially affect the business. However, at no time should this service denial be misconstrued as denial of credit.

NONE OF CommiHub, ANY OF ITS AFFILIATES, PROVIDERS OR THEIR RESPECTIVE OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, INDEPENDENT CONTRACTORS OR LICENSORS (COLLECTIVELY THE 'CommiHub PARTIES') GUARANTEES THE ACCURACY, ADEQUACY, TIMELINESS, RELIABILITY, COMPLETENESS, OR USEFULNESS OF ANY OF THE CONTENT AND CommiHub DISCLAIMS LIABILITY FOR ERRORS OR OMISSIONS IN THE CONTENT. WITH RESPECT TO THE SERVICES YOU HEREBY ACKNOWLEDGE YOUR UNDERSTANDING THAT CommiHub IS SOLELY AN INTERMEDIARY BETWEEN YOU AND THE CREDIT REPORTING AGENCIES (EXPERIAN, EQUIFAX, TRANSUNION) ACTUALLY FURNISHING THE CREDIT PROFILES AND SCORES AT ISSUE AND BETWEEN YOU AND THIRD-PARTY SITES (IN THE CASE OF THIRD PARTY PRODUCTS AND SERVICES); THEREFORE, THE CommiHub PARTIES HEREBY EXPRESSLY DISCLAIM ANY LIABILITY FOR THE INACCURACY OR INCOMPLETENESS OF ANY SUCH CREDIT PROFILES AND SCORES OR FOR THE CONTENT, AVAILABILITY, OR LEGALITY OF ANY OF THE PRODUCTS AND SERVICES MADE BY THE THIRD-PARTY SITES.

THIS SITE AND ALL OF THE CONTENT AND SERVICES ARE PROVIDED 'AS IS' AND 'AS AVAILABLE,' WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, NON-INFRINGEMENT OR TITLE. ADDITIONALLY, THERE ARE NO WARRANTIES AS TO THE RESULTS OF YOUR USE OF THE SITE, CONTENT OR SERVICES. THE CommiHub PARTIES DO NOT WARRANT THAT THE SITE IS FREE OF VIRUSES OR OTHER HARMFUL COMPONENTS, NOR THAT ANY INFORMATION THAT YOU PROVIDE TO THE WEBSITE WILL BE SECURE. THIS DOES NOT AFFECT THOSE WARRANTIES WHICH ARE INCAPABLE OF EXCLUSION, RESTRICTION OR MODIFICATION UNDER THE LAWS APPLICABLE TO THIS AGREEMENT.

CommiHub MAY DISCONTINUE OR MAKE CHANGES IN THE SITE, THE CONTENT, AND/OR THE SERVICES AT ANY TIME WITHOUT PRIOR NOTICE TO YOU AND WITHOUT ANY LIABILITY TO YOU OR ANY THIRD PARTY. ANY DATED INFORMATION IS PUBLISHED AS OF ITS DATE ONLY, AND THE CommiHub PARTIES DO NOT UNDERTAKE ANY OBLIGATION OR RESPONSIBILITY TO UPDATE OR AMEND ANY SUCH INFORMATION. CommiHub RESERVES THE RIGHT TO TERMINATE ANY OR ALL SITE OFFERINGS OR TRANSMISSIONS WITHOUT PRIOR NOTICE TO YOU. THIS SITE COULD CONTAIN TECHNICAL INACCURACIES OR TYPOGRAPHICAL ERRORS. USE OF THIS SITE IS AT YOUR OWN RISK.

Limitation of Liability

UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES WILL THE CommiHub PARTIES BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, GENERAL, SPECIAL, DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, PUNITIVE OR ANY OTHER DAMAGES (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, LOST PROFITS OR BUSINESS INTERRUPTION) OF ANY KIND WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR NEGLIGENCE ARISING OR RELATING IN ANY WAY TO THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE BY ANY PARTY OF THE SITE, THE CONTENT, THE SERVICES, OR ANY THIRD-PARTY SITE TO WHICH THIS SITE IS LINKED, OR IN CONNECTION WITH ANY FAILURE OF PERFORMANCE, ERROR, OMISSION, INTERRUPTION, DEFECT, DELAY IN OPERATION OR TRANSMISSION, COMPUTER VIRUS OR LINE OR SYSTEM FAILURE, EVEN IF THE CommiHub PARTIES, OR REPRESENTATIVES THEREOF, ARE ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES, LOSSES OR EXPENSES. THE CommiHub PARTIES ARE NOT LIABLE FOR ANY DEFAMATORY, OFFENSIVE OR ILLEGAL CONDUCT OF ANY USER.
